page.title: 15Public Services
page.content: WATER TREATMENT CENTRE, GLASCOED The Water Treatment Centre came into operation in 1870, was bought by Rhyl U.D.C. in 1893 and in 1965 was transferred to West Denbighshire and West Flintshire Water Board. The 1973 Water Act meant that the Board was dissolved and the undertaking was taken over by the Welsh National Development Authority in 1974. Water is released from reservoirs at Llyn Aled and Aled Isaf on the Denbigh Moors, into the River Aled from which water can only be pumped provided that the residual flow exceeds 5 million gallons a day. To increase any necessary flow in the river, the water is then released. Water from the River Aled and various other resources (springs, boreholes etc.) are integrated into the pipelines to the Glascoed Treatment Plant.
